descriptionHtml:
[size=3][font=Times New Roman]Now first off all the credit for the face goes to [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/users/2650523/?tb=about&pUp=1]rxkx22[/url],
they have beautiful followers and I really wanted to use their faces for my character.

ok the mods I used are (and I recommend you use the if you want the same look) :
[/font][/size]
[size=3][font=Times New Roman]- [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/29624/?]RaceMenu[/url]
- [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/2666/?]CBBE[/url]
- [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/51602/?]Fair Skin Complexion[/url]
- [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/52841/?]Freckle Mania[/url]
- [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/7127/?]RANs HeadMesh Variants - Type C[/url]
- [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/67147/?]PAINTERLY[/url]
- [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/31665/?]Better Makeup for SKSE - Hight Res Female Face Makeup for SKSE[/url]
- [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/68311/?]KS Hairdos[/url]
- SKSE.ini

add this line to your SKSE.ini (create one if you don't have it)[/font]


[/size][size=3]    [Display]
[/size][size=3]    iTintTextureResolution=2048
[font=Times New Roman]

How to load the preset in-game :[/font]
[/size][size=3]
Go to the Preset tab in RaceMenu, click Load Preset and load either the dunmerdunmer file or dunmeraltmer (the preset files are only for dunmer and altmer, the sculpt file is for any humanoid race)
if your head looks weird or not how it is supposed to go to the Sculpt tab and import the .nif file I included called dunmer head, that should fix it.[/size]
[size=3]With that you can use the preset with any race really, except the beast races of course


[font=Times New Roman]Now again all face credit goes to rxkx22,
I am not going to maka a follower out of this because first, I do not know how and second, rxkx22 already has great followers with basically the same face (or even better looking), so don't ask me to do that and go download them :)


Installation:

Use Nexus Manager or drag and drop the Data folder to [/font][/size][font=Times New Roman][size=3]\Steam\steamapps\common\Skyrim[/size][/font]
author: JimmyPotatoPage
